item.title: [PHP] Processing Multiple Dropdowns With Dynamic Names [Help]
item.dc:creator: @D4rtZ D4rtZ
item.description:
@D4rtZ wrote:

Before I post the code:

  1. I’m not genius
  2. This is most likely a terrible way to do it
  3. I’m not even entirely sure what you were trying to achieve.
  4. I didn’t even test the code!

foreach($columnsA as $pend) { echo " <tr> <td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'>". $pend ."</td> <td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'> <select name='myField[]'> <option value='".$pend."+custom'>Custom</option> <option disabled style='color: red;'>Member Information</option> <option value='".$pend."+member-type-code'>Member Type Code</option> <option value='".$pend."+primary_group_code'>Primary Group Code</option> </select> </td> <td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'> <input type='text' name='". $pend ."' /> </td> </tr>"; echo "<input type='hidden' name='columnsToKeep[]' value='".$pend."' />"; }

[code]foreach($_POST as $key => $value)
{
switch($key)
{
case “myField”:
/*
* $values[0] = Your $pend variable.
* $values[1] = Field’s name.
*/
$values = explode(’+’, $value);
switch($values[1])
{
case “custom”:
echo $values[0] . ’ AND custom’;
break;
case “member_type_code”:
echo $values[0] . ’ AND member_type_code’;
break;
case “primary_group_code”:
echo $values[0] . ’ AND primary_group_code’;
break;
}
break;

	default:
		//Do nothing :)
		break;
}

}[/code]

Please do not hate on meh.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Processing Multiple Dropdowns With Dynamic Names [Help]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I don’t know if I’m tired today or what, but I just can’t seem to get this straight today. Basically, I’m building an application where the user can upload a CSV file (comma separated values) and change the file using a PHP based application. The system works, but I want to include drop down boxes. After uploading the CSV, a user can select to change names of columns. If they say they need to change names, it takes them to the next screen where they choose new names. For choosing new names there is the option of selecting a common name from a drop down box (first name, last name, etc.) or selecting Custom and typing in a text box the new name. How do I coordinate a system like this? This is some of my current code, but I can’t seem to get everything working.

The below is what constructs the table where they can change the name, for each kept column. $columnsA is an arrray with column names to change the names of… This is where I’m having problems, since each dropdown will have a different name, for each item to change.

foreach($columnsA as $pend) { echo "<tr><td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'>". $pend ."</td><td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'><select name='ymField[]' value='".$pend."'> <option name='".$pend."' value='Custom'>Custom</option> <option disabled style='color: red;'>Member Information</option> <option value='Member_Type_Code'>Member Type Code</option> <option value='Primary_Group_Code'>Primary Group Code</option> </select></td><td style='text-align: center; border: 1px solid black;'><input type='text' name='". $pend ."' /></td></tr>"; echo "<input type='hidden' name='columnsToKeep[]' value='".$pend."' />"; }

This code is for actually (trying to) process the selected names.

[code]foreach($POST as $key => $value) {
if($key != ‘columnsToKeep’ && $key != ‘filename’ && $key != ‘tablename’ && $key != ‘rawstring’) {
if(!empty($value)) {
mysql_query("alter table “.$tablename.” change “.$key.” “. str_replace(” ", "", $value) ." text");
echo “Changing ".$key." to ". $value ."… Success!”;
$newColumnsToKeep[] = str_replace(" ", “", $value);
} else {
echo “The field ".$key." doesn’t not be changed… Skipped”;
$newColumnsToKeep[] = str_replace(" ", "”, $key);
}

			}
		}[/code]

Thanks to anyone that can help!

Read full topic
item.source: [PHP] Processing Multiple Dropdowns With Dynamic Names [Help]
